intro: Strobilanthes lakshminarasimhanii, commonly known as the Lakshminarayanan's strobilanthes, is a flowering plant native to the Western Ghats of India. It belongs to the Acanthaceae family and is characterized by its striking, showy inflorescences. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments within tropical forests. Its flowering period occurs during the monsoon season, and it is known for its unique floral structure. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
